channel.title: How to set iteams on the ground
channel.description:
i just got my own server but i need to no how to put itemsa on the ground
news need a coder

item.title: How to set iteams on the ground
item.dc:creator: @Khasck Khasck
item.description:
@Khasck wrote:

i know its a java file, thank you, but in his perspective, it would look like itemspawnpoints under a text document like notepad.
it wouldnt say itemspawnpoints.java
and that throws new coders off, becuase they think of java being a .bat and they dont think it would just be a text file, so they click on .cfg or look for a .bat.
so when i say, its a text file, i mean, its a file, thats using notepad to section text, which would initially help the new coder.

-Will

Read full topic
item.source: How to set iteams on the ground

item.title: How to set iteams on the ground
item.dc:creator: @alex4ever alex4ever
item.description:
@alex4ever wrote:

[quote=“Khasck, post:3, topic:93183”]1.) open up your source file. (mines fr33sc4p3, but this tut will work with any)
2.) find itemspawnpoints.java
3.) add an item to the list, following the rest of the code.

so for me, if i wanted to add a white phat to be dropped on mod island, i would put the coorinates for where i want it droped, and then i would put in the item ID.
like so:

ItemHandler.addItem(1048, 2325, 3161, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false);

and if you want help with that then:
the first number, 1048, is the Item ID (being a white party hat)
the second umber, 2325, is the X coords.
the third number, 3161, is the Y Coords.
and the last number, is the amount you want dropped there.
hope this helped yaa,

-Will[/quote]so just add the code

witch on i go with
this one

tut2.jpg800×600

or this one

tuts.jpg800×600

Read full topic
item.source: How to set iteams on the ground

item.title: How to set iteams on the ground
item.dc:creator: @Khasck Khasck
item.description:
@Khasck wrote:

1.) open up your source file. (mines fr33sc4p3, but this tut will work with any)
2.) find itemspawnpoints.java
3.) add an item to the list, following the rest of the code.

so for me, if i wanted to add a white phat to be dropped on mod island, i would put the coorinates for where i want it droped, and then i would put in the item ID.
like so:

ItemHandler.addItem(1048, 2325, 3161, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false);

and if you want help with that then:
the first number, 1048, is the Item ID (being a white party hat)
the second umber, 2325, is the X coords.
the third number, 3161, is the Y Coords.
and the last number, is the amount you want dropped there.
hope this helped yaa,

-Will

Read full topic
